A clean and scalable architecture
for complex javascript applications.

Aura implements a decoupled and event driven architecture so you can build safe and scalable javascript applications.

Download Documentation View on Github

Why aura ?

There are many ways to develop Javascript applications, and almost as many frameworks.

Beyond that, giving your application a structure that stays safe and scales gracefully along your application is something that requires expertise and foresight.

The problem is you only see the flaws in retrospect, which is the reason so many apps get rewritten over and over again.

Aura implements a set of proved patterns and organizes them so you can rest assured that your code does not turn into spaghetti over time, while trying to stay framework-agnostic

Aura to the rescue.

Aura implements a set of proved patterns and organizes them so you can rest assured that your code does not turn into spaghetti over time, while trying to stay framework-agnostic

Aura is a decoupled, event-driven architecture for developing widget-based applications.

Aura introduces proven patterns and best practices for developing maintainable applications, while giving you greater control over widget-based applications.

Aura gives you complete control of a widget's lifecycle, allowing developers to dynamically start, stop, reload and clean-up parts of their application as needed.

The project is based on concepts discussed by Nicholas Zakas in Scalable Application Architecture and by Addy in Large-scale Application Development.
